questions.question: What does the array [9, 12, 3, 4, 7, 5, 6] look like after three iterations of Insertion Sort?

explanations.b: Incorrect. Remember 3 iterations sorts the first 4 elements.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Remember 3 iterations sorts the first 4 elements.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Remember an iteration sorts a given element with respect to those to its left.

questions.question: Three iterations of Insertion Sort yields the array [1, 3, 5, 8, 4, 11, 6]. What does the array look like after the fourth iteration?
After K iterations of Insertion Sort, how many elements have been sorted(Relative to the left of the current index)?
What type of array is optimal for Insertion Sort?
What is insertion sort's time complexity in Big O notation?

answers.a: Best: O(N^2) Average: O(N) Worst: O(N)
answers.b: Best: O(N) Average: O(N^2) Worst: O(N^2)
answers.c: Best: O(N^2) Average: O(N^2) Worst: O(N^2)
answers.d: Best: O(N) Average: O(N) Worst: O(N)
